segments.text: I notice the girl standing there, reaching up for a cookie like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t seem to care that her brother is about to fall off that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s just as guilty as he is for not paying attention to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still pouring out of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the girl even realizes how much trouble they could be in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool is wobbling like crazy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is one of those moments where everything is about to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying that plate, completely oblivious to everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really step in and stop them before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But maybe they’ll be fine, and I’m just worrying too much.
segments.speaker: PAR
